name: Optimizing water resources management in large river basins with integrated surface water-groundwater modeling: A surrogate-based approach
abstraction: The paper introduces some generalizations of Vapnik's (1982) method of structural risk minimization (SRM). As well as making explicit some of the details on SRM, it provides a result that allows one to trade off errors on the training sample against improved generalization performance. It then considers the more general case when the hierarchy of classes is chosen in response to the data. A result is presented on the generalization performance of classifiers with a â€œlarge marginâ€?. This theoretically explains the impressive generalization performance of the maximal margin hyperplane algorithm of Vapnik and co-workers (which is the basis for their support vector machines).
